Bang for the buck
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Campus is a pretty safe place to be during daytime or weekdays, but don't leave anything valuable in your vehicle.
Iowa State has so many clubs, it is tough to find an interest that doesn't have a club. Students will always have something to do with their time.
Iowa State is a great place for students who are willing to put work and time into their studies.
The most notable traditions is the Campanile, which is a huge clock tower. Students will take their lovers and kiss at midnight when the bells strike.
This is a great college, reasonably priced. It is a wonderful place to get a degree.

There are so many fun things to do at Iowa State. Most people think partying when thinking about college, but there is so much more. There is a club for almost every interest, a robotics club, politics clubs, business clubs, a club that builds go carts for competition, unicycle clubs, if you want it, there is a club for it.
The dining selections are great, but hilariously overpriced.
Dorm life is great for a first year student, but not for students further along in their career who really need alone time for studying.

The engineering classes at Iowa State are extremely well rounded. If you study hard, do the homework, and really work for it, an A is completely achievable. If you don't study, your grade will reflect it.

Get involved with as many possible activities as you can, find a job on campus, and most importantly, don't be the same person you were in high school. You are in a new place, be whoever you want to be, no matter what you will find friends.

Iowa State University is a great college in that it allows each student to be as involved as they want. Multiple opportunities wait around every corner, in every building, in every lecture, in every club. It is a wonderful place to explore yourself, and to develop professional relationships that will last a lifetime.

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here Ames, IA has one of the lowest crime rates in the U.S., and is generally relaxed. Football and basketball games are an absolute blast, and the town does get a little crazy. The school has a very friendly atmosphere, and it's easy to meet new people. There are all kinds of big events that happen, like E-Week or VEISHEA (if you don't know about VEISHEA yet, Google it), but there are also plenty of small ones. Whether you collect famous toothbrushes or like smashing computers to bits, you can find a student organization to share your passion with others. In short, it's hard not to enjoy Iowa State. Am learning a lot You learn a lot in college, but at Iowa State you can learn anything you could imagine. The professors are true experts in their fields, and do an excellent job teaching. The living experience at ISU leads to a lot of great insights too, especially if you're living in Friley or Helser Halls. Login to rate or flag the reviews Meghan from Walnut, IL 06/09/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 14 out of
